StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [InsertUpdateEventPlanOwners]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@ID uniqueidentifier, @EventID uniqueidentifier, @OwnerID uniqueidentifier, @LastUpdateDate date.me, @LastUpadteUserID uniqueidentifier, @CreatorID uniqueidentifier
AS BEGIN
-- STEP 1: Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF EXISTS(SELECT ID FROM [RSSOSS].[USMC].[EventPlanOwners] WHERE ID = @ID) BEGIN
UPDATE [RSSOSS].[USMC].[EventPlanOwners] SET [EventID] = @EventID, [OwnerID] = @OwnerID, [LastUpdateDate] = @LastUpdateDate, [LastUpadteUserID] = @LastUpadteUserID, [CreatorID] = @CreatorID WHERE [ID] = @ID
END ELSE BEGIN
-- if @intCount = 0, then the Record does not exist. INSERT. INSERT INTO [RSSOSS].[USMC].[EventPlanOwners] (ID, EventID, OwnerID, LastUpdateDate, LastUpadteUserID, CreatorID ) VALUES (@ID, @EventID, @OwnerID, @LastUpdateDate, @LastUpadteUserID, @CreatorID )
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- STEP 4: If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
